decks.notes: This deck focuses on aggressive play with efficient creatures and disruptive spells to put pressure on the opponent. Utilizing powerful threats like Bloodtithe Harvester and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize, it aims to quickly take control of the game. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Blightstep Pathway and Duress helps disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a steady flow of threats. The deck is designed to win quickly and decisively by overwhelming the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent through a combination of direct damage spells, aggressive creatures, and using the abilities of cards like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Heartfire Hero. The deck also includes some versatile cards like Mutavault and Ramunap Ruins to provide additional damage or utility. Overall, the goal is to maintain a fast-paced tempo and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize or mount a defense.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly equipping creatures with powerful equipment like Colossus Hammer and Shadowspear to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. Cards like Sigarda's Aid and Sigarda's Aid help to get equipment onto the battlefield efficiently, while cards like Kemba, Kha Enduring and Kellan, the Fae-Blooded provide additional threats and resilience. The deck also includes removal like Seam Rip and defensive options like Sheltered by Ghosts to protect your creatures and keep the pressure on the opponent. Overall, the strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient attacks.

Dimir Aggro focuses on using disruptive spells and efficient creatures to pressure opponents and control the game. The deck includes a mix of hand disruption with cards like Thoughtseize, removal with Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, and aggressive creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Moon-Circuit Hacker. By combining control elements with a fast clock, Dimir Aggro aims to keep opponents on the back foot and disrupt their game plan, ultimately leading to victory through efficient aggression and disruption.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to reanimate Arclight Phoenix, while also using cheap spells for damage and card draw. It includes various ways to trigger Arclight Phoenix's ability, such as Lightning Axe and Fiery Impulse, as well as card draw spells like Treasure Cruise and Opt to maintain resources. The deck aims to be aggressive and overwhelming, putting pressure on the opponent early in the game and utilizing the Phoenix's recurring presence to maintain momentum.

The main concept of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy by using a variety of discard spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, and powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Graveyard Trespasser. Additionally, the deck aims to gain card advantage through cards like Castle Locthwain and Liliana of the Veil, while also utilizing land destruction with cards like Field of Ruin. The inclusion of Blade of the Oni and Archenemy's Charm provides additional versatility and options for controlling the game.

The Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive gameplay by utilizing efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, along with powerful creatures such as Bloodtithe Harvester and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to control the opponent's hand. Additionally, the deck features additional support from cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance to further strengthen its aggro strategy. The goal is to apply pressure early and maintain control throughout the game to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying a swarm of small but powerful creatures to overwhelm the opponent and deal damage quickly. By utilizing cards like Adeline, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Warden of the Inner Sky, the deck aims to put constant pressure on the opponent and maintain board presence. With efficient mana base and a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells like Portable Hole and Extraction Specialist, this deck aims to win the game through speed and relentless attacks before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This control deck focuses on utilizing powerful spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It includes counterspells like Dovin's Veto and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to prevent threats from resolving, while also using card draw and filtering effects from cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Consult the Star Charts. The deck also has removal options like Supreme Verdict and Field of Ruin, as well as alternate win conditions such as Shark Typhoon. Overall, the strategy is to outvalue the opponent and control the game until a win condition can be secured.

This deck focuses on assembling the Greasefang Parhelion combo, utilizing cards like Guardian of New Benalia, Seasoned Hallowblade, and Sheltered by Ghosts to protect and support the combo pieces. The deck also includes Thoughtseize and Fatal Push for disruption and removal, as well as lands like Godless Shrine and Concealed Courtyard for mana fixing. The goal is to establish a strong board presence with the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful synergies and protection.

The primary focus of this deck is to aggressively control the board and disrupt your opponent's strategy. By utilizing cards like Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, and Go for the Throat, you can eliminate threats while putting pressure on your opponent with evasive creatures like Mockingbird and Moon-Circuit Hacker. Kaito, Bane of Nightmares serves as a powerful finisher, while Enduring Curiosity allows you to draw additional cards. The deck also includes mana-fixing lands like Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth and Darkslick Shores to ensure you can cast your spells consistently.

This Esper Aggro deck aims to disrupt opponents with hand disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize, while also removing threats with cards like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse. The deck utilizes powerful creatures like Valki, God of Lies and Cecil, Dark Knight to pressure opponents and close out the game quickly. The deck also includes cards like Raffine, Scheming Seer and Nashi, Searcher in the Dark to help maintain card advantage and provide additional value. The manabase is designed to support the three-color combination, ensuring smooth gameplay and consistent access to all necessary colors of mana.

The deck focuses on utilizing Enigmatic Incarnation to consistently tutor for powerful creatures and disruption cards to control the game. By sacrificing creatures of different converted mana costs, the deck can effectively search for specific answers from the deck, such as removal or threats. The combination of various creatures and enchantments allows for versatile gameplay and adaptability to different matchups, while maintaining a strong control strategy throughout the game. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a powerful board presence to secure victory.

The key focus of this Mono Black Control deck is to utilize a combination of discard spells, removal spells, and creatures with disruptive abilities to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By constantly stripping their opponent's hand of key cards, removing threats from the board, and applying pressure with resilient creatures, the deck aims to create a favorable board state and win through attrition. The inclusion of powerful threats like Liliana of the Veil and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse adds additional win conditions to close out the game.

The primary focus of this deck is to maintain control over the game through various means such as hand disruption, removal spells, and powerful creatures that can dominate the battlefield. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while slowly building up its own board presence. With a combination of powerful spells like Thoughtseize and Liliana of the Veil, along with resilient creatures like Graveyard Trespasser and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, this Mono Black Control deck aims to grind out value and outlast the opponent in a battle of attrition.

The main focus of this mono black control deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan by using a variety of removal spells and hand disruption like Thoughtseize and Duress. By utilizing powerful creatures like Gifted Aetherborn and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, coupled with powerful spells such as Fatal Push and Archenemy's Charm, this deck aims to control the tempo of the game and slowly wear down the opponent's resources until victory is inevitable. The inclusion of cards like Mutavault and Castle Locthwain provide additional utility and card advantage to help maintain the upper hand in the match.
